result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Defendant Waylon D Jones in court without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint. Court reads charges. Court requests defendant to call Public Defender Office. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess controlled substance and only take medications as prescribed.

***Cash previously posted***

10:55 AM Defendant Waylon D Jones appeared by phone.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he received complaint.  Court reads charges. Defendant has not contacted public defender.  Court provides PD telephone number to defendant.  $250 cash bond set with conditions: Not to possess controlled substance and only take medications as prescribed.  Cash previously posted at time of warrant posting.  Bond form to be mailed to defendant.  Defendant advised to sign and return bond form by next hearing date.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Defendant Waylon D Jones not in court, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court issues a $250.00 bench warrant on the non appearance.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Court sets adjourned initial appearance to February 28th at 9:30 am. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court will find probable cause of criminal activity and set a $1000.00 signature bond. Conditions, not to possess controlled substance and only take medications as prescribed. Court sets initial appearance to February 9th at 1:00 pm.

Not to possess controlled substance and only take medications as prescribed.
